titleStmt.title: The intrigues of the French King, and others, for extirpating the Protestant religion, by them called the Northern Heresie, and establishing popery in England, Scotland, Ireland, &c. Managed by letters from Mr. Coleman to the French King's confessor, the Pope's inter-nuncio, Card. Norfolk, &c.
titleStmt.author: Treby, George, Sir, 1644?-1700.
Coleman, Edward, d. 1678.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed: and are to be sold by Randall Taylor, near Stationers-Hall,

notesStmt.note: Includes letters to and from Edward Coleman.
Editor's note "To the reader" signed: Geo. Treby.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C..
